Brazil's Senate leader Pacheco says government to revoke payroll tax proposalBrazilian Senate leader Rodrigo Pacheco said on Friday the government would revoke a proposal it made to phase out the extension of payroll tax exemptions for various labor sectors, yielding to the will of the lawmakers on the matter. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 15:08:14 GMT PEOERVL2X5OSXB6PYXTEZQ3IBI https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/brazil-senate-leader-pacheco-says-government-revoke-payroll-tax-proposal-2024-01-19/Reuters世界美洲
US Treasury, Chinese finance officials agree to keep meeting after Beijing talksMeetings between U.S. Treasury and Chinese financial officials in Beijing this week concluded with both sides agreeing to continue to meet regularly, the Treasury Department said on Friday. Iran's desire for 'a seat at the table' felt in DavosAt a dinner in the Swiss ski resort of Davos this week, Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani hosted business and political leaders to showcase Iraq's improved security and finances. Prince Harry withdraws libel claim against British tabloidIn December, he lost his attempt to have the paper's defence to his libel lawsuit thrown out, meaning he would have likely had to give evidence at London's High Court later this year. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 14:31:19 GMT KCRGURA7EBP4PDYW7AM5NA4OMY https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/britain-prince-harry-withdraws-libel-claim-against-mail-sunday-pa-2024-01-19/Reuters世界英国
Spain's Melia Hotels to pay Daddy Yankee nearly $1 million for jewellery theftA Spanish court has ordered hotel chain Melia to compensate Latin music star Daddy Yankee and his wife with $908,950 for a jewellery theft from a hotel room in 2020, court documents showed on Friday. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 14:29:20 GMT YXLVBAKYQRII7GCNZ2LJMYZU3A https://www.reuters.com/world/spains-melia-hotels-pay-daddy-yankees-nearly-1-million-jewellery-theft-2024-01-19/Reuters世界
Czech court rules Indian man can be extradited to US, justice minister to decideA Czech appeals court has ruled that Prague can extradite to the United States an Indian man accused by the U.S. of involvement in an unsuccessful plot to kill a Sikh separatist on American soil, the Justice Ministry said on Friday. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 14:06:48 GMT JG7UWYWI5FJFNNBBLSCMGFZ2EI https://www.reuters.com/world/czech-court-rules-indian-man-can-be-extradited-us-justice-minister-decides-2024-01-19/Reuters世界
Russia says it pressed Hamas to free hostages during Moscow delegation visitThe Russian foreign ministry said on Friday it had received a delegation from the Hamas militant movement and had urged it to release hostages the group is holding in the Gaza strip, including three Russian nationals. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 14:04:19 GMT 7C52UIFINJPIHCLIJSVL5O6LDQ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ Russia-says-it-pressed-hamas-free-hostages-during-moscow-delegation-visit-2024-01-19/Reuters世界欧洲
Japan starts precision landing of 'moon sniper' SLIM spacecraftJapan started a "precision" landing attempt of its moon probe on Saturday, its bid to become the world's fifth country to achieve a moonshot and revitalise a space programme that has suffered a wave of recent setbacks. Ambiguous Italian court ruling on fascist salute delights extreme rightPerforming a stiff-armed fascist salute is not a crime in Italy unless it risks sparking violence or is aimed at reviving the fascist party, the Supreme Court has ruled in a verdict that delighted extreme-right groups. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 13:35:33 GMT NTNNNVLBHFNSFMWD5Y6NHTAH7Y https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ambiguously-italian-court-ruling-fascist-saute-delights-extreme-right-2024-01-19/Crispian Balmer世界欧洲
Switzerland says Israeli president subject of criminal complaints at DavosSwiss prosecutors on Friday confirmed that Israeli President Isaac Herzog had been the subject of criminal complaints during his visit to the World Economic Forum in Davos, as Israel finds itself accused of committing war crimes in Gaza. Non-Aligned Movement leaders denounce Israel's military campaign in GazaLeaders of Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) countries on Friday denounced Israel's military campaign in Gaza and demanded an immediate ceasefire there, during the annual summit of the 120-member bloc.
